title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Thursday 25 May 2017 - BBC News
summary: armed police begin regular patrols in devon and cornwall .
plymouth drink-driver jailed for christmas eve crash death .
number of people who drowned in cornwall doubles in 12 months .
almost 300,000 people in south west taken to court for not paying council tax in five years .
new breeding centre and reserve opening for cornish black bees .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on friday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .

documents.title: armed police on streets of devon and cornwall
text: armed police will be regularly out on the streets of devon and cornwall from this evening following the terrorist attack which killed at least 22 people in manchester .
assistant chief constable russ middleton , from devon and cornwall police , said this was the first time armed police would be carrying out `` overt foot patrols '' in the region .
the move is being mirrored across the country and follows the announcement by prime minister theresa may that the uk has been moved from severe to critical alert level .
acc middleton said : `` our priority is to provide as much reassurance to communities as possible , but we do recognise that some may feel anxious .
`` the firearms officers will be engaging and talking with people , and we would actively encourage you to approach the officers and ask any questions you may have . ''
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: latest weather : staying dry and sunny on friday
text: it will be a fine evening with plenty of late , warm sunshine on offer .
a dry night will then follow with clear skies across most areas .
it will be a mild night and rather humid for all .
minimum temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
friday will be dry , sunny and very warm again .
the sunshine may become a little hazy later in the west as high cloud spreads in .
maximum temperature : 24c ( 75f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: cornwall 's unpaid council tax 'is collected '
text: cornwall council claims much of £ 60m owed in council tax over the last five years has now been recovered .
a bbc freedom of information request revealed the authority has issued more than 100,000 liability orders since 2010 .
new council leader adam paynter said people had to pay up in the end .
he said : `` nearly 97.5 % of council tax bills that went out were paid last year .
for that 2.5 % that we do n't collect , we then go through various stages of trying to agree with people payment plans , so we do continue to collect council tax in the years following .
`` if you do n't pay one year , we do n't just say : 'fine , we 'll let you off ' ; we will take you to court .
it 's one of those taxes that you have to pay . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: new film celebrates work behind conserving the cornish chough
text: students from falmouth university have produced a short film for the rspb about cornwall 's choughs and met people who work behind the scenes to support the birds ' conservation .

documents.title: torquay united : luke young midfielder signs new contract
text: torquay united midfielder luke young has signed a contract extension of undisclosed length to stay with the national league club .
young was out of contract at torquay , who he joined from league two side plymouth in june 2014 .
the 24-year-old has played in 87 league games for the gulls , and won their player of the season award in 2016-17 .
`` last season he got stronger and better with each game , '' player-manager kevin nicholson told the club website .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: christmas eve drink-drive victim 'in constant pain '
text: a teenage girl run over by a drink-driver on christmas eve has been left in constant pain , a court has heard .
ruby-tuesday hobbs was crossing the road with friends when ashley godber 's blue bmw collided with her near drake 's circus shopping centre in plymouth .
she had to be freed from railings before being taken to hospital , where she remained for 16 days .
she spent 18 hours in surgery and had a metal rod and metal plates put into her legs .
in an impact statement read out in plymouth crown court , the 18-year-old said that , as well as the pain , the incident had left her self-conscious due to the `` disgusting scars '' on her legs .
godber , 27 , from plymouth , was more than twice the legal alcohol and speed limits when he crashed .
he was jailed for two years and four months after admitting causing serious injury by dangerous driving .
the court heard that he was `` truly ashamed and very sorry '' for what he 'd done .
outside court , a member of miss hobbs ' family said his sentence was `` disgusting '' .
author: John Danks, BBC Spotlight

documents.title: the high life : a job where you tower above everyone else
text: do you fancy a job where you literally go up in the world ?
in this case , it 's another photo we have of someone at the top of the tower of the national maritime museum in falmouth .
those of us without a head for heights took a look at it and went `` argh ! ''
@ twitterid @ twitterid another scary pic of the work on @ twitterid this morning @ twitterid
author: Julie Skentelbery
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: gp payout for cancer misdiagnosis
text: a musician dying from skin cancer whose gp misdiagnosed his condition as a fungal nail infection has won almost £ 180,000 in damages .
devon man peter cosgrove , 60 , went to see family doctor asaad al-doori at blake house surgery , in black torrington , in september 2011 and was prescribed anti-fungal medication .
in june 2012 , he went back to the surgery and a different doctor referred him to hospital where he was diagnosed with a rare form of skin cancer .
at london 's high court , mr justice goss said : `` the disease will cause his death , the latest prognosis is that he may have 10-30 months of life left . ''
mr cosgrove , of market street , hatherleigh , devon , sued dr al-doori , claiming his negligence cost him years of life .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: divers deployed to recover 'misfired ordnance '
text: a dive unit from devonport has successful recovered two rounds that failed to fire properly from a dutch navy ship off plymouth .
the rounds from the cruiser de ruyter were chaff , containing small strips of metal used to deter enemy fire and protect the ship , but they failed to detonate .
the vessel was there as part of a military exercise .
divers recovered them at tinker shoal off plymouth breakwater at 07:00 .
they disposed of them in a marked seabed away from shipping .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: manchester attack minute 's silence : the south west pays tribute
text: a minute 's silence has been held across the uk , including in devon and cornwall , for the 22 people killed and the 64 others wounded in the bomb attack in manchester .
in cornwall , tributes included st columb major 's church ringing half-muffled bells .
other tributes include flowers being left at memorials , including some at truro 's war memorial (
a gesture of respect for the victims of the manchester bombing from the bell-ringers of st columb major .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: float to stay alive , says rnli
text: the rnli is advising people who at risk of drowning to `` fight your instinct and try to float '' in a new campaign .
it comes on the day the charity has revealed figures for the number of drownings in the last year .
in cornwall , there were 21 drownings in 2016 , more than double the number in 2015 when there were nine .
in devon , the number of deaths fell by almost half to eight last year .

steve instance , rnli community safety partner for the south west , said : `` if people in danger in the water can help themselves initially by floating and regaining control of their breathing , they stand a much greater chance of surviving . ''
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: mr boots , the passport-eating dog , a tv star
text: rugby player matt shepherd talked to us yesterday about being left in a `` nightmare '' predicament after his dog chewed up his passport ahead of an overseas tour .
seven-month-old cocker spaniel mr boots destroyed the document less than two weeks before matt 's flight to spain for a two-match england counties tour .
the plymouth albion player was forced to make an eight-hour round trip to south wales to get a new passport .
it was an interesting variation on the old theme of `` the dog has eaten my homework '' , we thought .
but as you can see from his tweeted video above , matt seems happy that mr boots is now a tv star .
he 's made it # mrboots
hi , matt .
can we feature this tweet on the bbc local live feed today ?
more fame for mr boots !
thanks .
andrew
yes not a problem
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: blazing sunshine , 4ft waves and an offshore breeze
text: if , like us , you 're sitting in an office somewhere , you may not want to read this post .
it 's sunny across the south west and , according to surf forecasting website www.magicseaweed.com , there are 3-4ft waves and an offshore wind on devon 's north coast .
may be a good day to sneak off early .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: why does emma need a wetsuit for her spotlight filming ?
text: you can find out why on spotlight at 18:30 on bbc one .
when your filming sheet involves a wetsuit you know it 's going to be a fun day .
you may also want to cover your eyes for @ twitterid
author: Emma Thomasson
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: exmouth lifeboat rescues two
text: today we rescued 2 men from broken down sailboat : 1 jumped in to retrieve rudder .
please # respectthewater & do n't put yourself at any risk .

documents.title: elderly man injured in crash
text: an elderly man 's been seriously injured and flown to hospital after a road accident between bude and bideford .
the police say a tractor and a motorbike were involved in the crash this lunchtime on the a39 between kilkhampton and higher clovelly .
the road is still understood to be closed .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: waster supply problems in yeo barton and bishops nympton
text: ex36 4pn : engineers are currently onsite & aim to restore supplies by 17:00 .
further info # yeobarton

documents.title: historic exeter print firm goes into administration
text: a printing company that dates back to 1780 has gone into administration .
wheatons , based in exeter , has annual sales of around £ 6m and currently employs 37 staff .
kre corporate recovery was appointed as administrators to the book and journal printers on 16 may .
gather roberts , from the company , said there has been some interest : `` we have narrowed it down to five or six interested parties .
we need a deal to be made in the next week . ''
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: family demand answers after 'mentally ill ' prisoner found dead at hmp exeter
text: a man found dead at hmp exeter had a history of mental illness and was on remand at the jail accused stabbing his mother , it has been confirmed .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: snake found in launceston
text: what is believed to be a corn snake has been found in launceston .
a man found the creature on st leonard 's road in the town and took it to castle vets , where it is now being looked after .
vet mark tucker said : `` we do n't get many snakes around here .
we think it 's probably somebody 's pet that 's got out .
we are looking for the owners , or if not , then somebody who can give the snake a home . ''
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: bowling : a sport for the young ?
text: when you think of bowls you probably silver-haired pensioners dressed in whites , enjoying a gentle afternoon in the sun .
one bowling club in cornwall is trying to change that image .
ten teams of schoolchildren aged between nine and 11 are about to do battle at chacewater bowling club , near truro , in one of four regional finals .
the best two sides will be going on to the school games in june .
great to see youngsters from @ twitterid getting the # bowls bug ahead of school games finals @ bowlseng @ twitterid
author: Dick Straughan
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: travel : serious accidents in cornwall and devon
text: travel : serious accidents in cornwall and devon
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: musician wins £ 180,000 in damages after gp mistakes cancer for fungal nail infection
text: ​a musician dying from skin cancer whose gp misdiagnosed his condition as a fungal nail infection has won almost £ 180,000 in damages .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: devonport nuclear subs dockyard crane probe
text: an investigation has started into an `` incident '' involving a crane used for lifting nuclear material from submarines .
the crane was undergoing routine maintenance at devonport dockyard in plymouth said yard operators babcock .
no-one was injured said the company and the crane would be returned to service after the investigation .
the office for nuclear regulation , responsible for safety at the site , said there was no radiation release .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: ethan ampadu : exeter city youngster included in wales squad
text: exeter city teenager ethan ampadu is one of seven uncapped players named in wales ' squad for a training camp in portugal ahead of june 's world cup qualifier in serbia .
the 16-year-old defensive player has represented wales up to under-19 level , but is also eligible for england .
everton 's gethin jones and fellow defender tom lockyer of bristol rovers are also included .
barnsley forward marley watkins gets a first call up .
wales will hold a training camp in portugal ahead of the qualifier in serbia on 11 june .
real madrid forward gareth bale and aston villa defender neil taylor are suspended for the game and have not been included in chris coleman 's squad .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: memorial for cornish heroine emily hobhouse
text: more than 90 years after the death of a remarkable cornish woman , her home village plans to pay homage to her humanitarian and campaigning work .
emily hobhouse is revered by south africans for highlighting the plight of thousands of children put into british concentration camps during the boer war .
she was branded a traitor by the british , even though her work saved many lives .
now , nearly a century later , her life is to be remembered with a memorial at her birthplace in st ive .
author: Christine Butler
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: defibrillators 'must be checked regularly ' warning
text: defibrillators 'must be checked regularly ' warning

documents.title: car and mobility scooter in a379 accident
text: in teignmouth , the a379 dawlish road is partially blocked near woodway road due to an accident .
we understand it involves a car and a mobility scooter .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: poldark avoids clash with itv 's victoria with move to summer slot
text: period dramas poldark and victoria will not go head to head this year after the bbc confirmed that the new series of its epic adaption of winston graham 's novels will air in june rather than the autumn .
author: The Guardian

documents.title: manchester attack : police hq marks minute of silence
text: staff and officers at hq observing the 11am silence .
# westandtogether in memory of the victims of the manchester attack .

documents.title: weather : continuing a warm , sunny day
text: it is continuing a dry , warm and generally sunny day .
the light or moderate easterly breeze will become fresher at times across headlands on the south coast making it feel cooler than further inland .
maximum temperature : 24c ( 75f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: ashley godber jailed for crashing into ruby-tuesday hobbs in plymouth
text: a driver who smashed into railings and hit a teenager whilst driving at twice the legal alcohol and speed limits has been jailed for 28 months .
ashley godber , 27 , from plymouth , crashed into ruby-tuesday hobbs on christmas eve , leaving her with serious injuries , plymouth crown court heard .
ms hobbs , who was 18 at the time , was hit by his bmw in plymouth .
it mounted a central reservation on charles street outside drakes circus shopping centre at about 06:30 gmt , the court heard .
godber admitted causing serious injury by dangerous driving .
he was also banned from driving for five years .
author: John Danks, BBC Spotlight

documents.title: black bees breeding centre opening
text: a new breeding centre and reserve for cornish black bees will be opened today .
around 40 bee keepers in cornwall are now looking after the bees as they make a comeback .
the cornish black is more resistant to disease as also copes well with the wet winter climate here .
it 's hoped the new centre at the mount edgcumbe estate will help continue the growth .
the cornish black bee reserve will be opened later by sir tim smit and michael eavis .
author: Eleanor Parkinson
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: minute 's silence for manchester
text: the bbc will be observing the minute 's silence being held at 11:00 , to remember those who lost their lives in the manchester attack .

documents.title: people in devon and cornwall owe more than £ 100m in council tax
text: new figures show £ 115m is owed in council tax by residents in devon and cornwall .
the freedom of information request reveals that almost 300,000 people in the south west have been taken to court for not paying their council tax over the past five years .

cornwall council said : `` we are very aware of the impact of the current financial situation on people in cornwall and are working with householders who are facing genuine difficulties in meeting their commitments .
`` legal action , including the use of enforcement agents , is always taken as a last resort . ''
`` we will continue to collect unpaid council tax and business rates beyond the end of the financial year , with results in overall collection rates of approaching 99 % . ''
author: Anna Varle
BBC News Online

documents.title: phil dollman : exeter full-back thought wales chance had gone
text: new wales squad member phil dollman thought his hopes of an international call-up had passed him by .
but at the age of 32 the exeter full-back has been drafted into the wales squad for june 's two test tour against tonga and samoa .
dollman replaced injured cardiff blues teenager rhun williams and got the nod ahead of the likes of ospreys ' dan evans and rhys patchell at scarlets .
`` i thought i had missed out i am ecstatic , '' said dollman .
`` at 32 i thought and looked at that and saw they had some good young players so they are bringing guys on .
i thought it had probably passed by but gladly i have the opportunity now . ''
author: BBC Sport Wales

documents.title: man arrested in launceston on sus of aggressive cold-calling
text: a man has been arrested on sus of aggressive cold calling in launceston , attending properties without the necessary permits .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: muffled bells for manchester attack 's minute silence
text: a church in cornwall will be ringing half-muffled bells as part of the national minute 's silence to remember victims of the manchester attack .
st columb major 's bells will be rung in this way , which will see a leather pad on one side of each bell .
it is something usually done for remembrance and memorial services .
the minute 's silence is at 11:00 .
a minute 's silence will be held at 1100 for the victims of # manchesterbombing - the st columb major bells will ring half-muffled afterwards
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: a job where you literally go up in the world
text: not a job for the faint hearted !
work on @ twitterid in # falmouth
fred dibnah lives on !
author: Julie Skentelbery
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: pub fire in exeter 'suspected arson '
text: arson is suspected to be the cause of a fire at a pub in central exeter this morning .
fire crews from danes castle and middlemoor were called to the sawyer 's arms pub in cowick street at about 08:15 .
devon and somerset fire said the fire started outside the back of the building where there was a large pile of wood .
the fire is out and the building has been partially damaged .
# fire outside # publichouse # cowick street # exeter
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: no jail for man who had seven-inch knife in plymouth street
text: a man caught walking down the street with a seven-inch kitchen knife wo n't be jailed because he has significant learning difficulties and his intent was to harm himself , not others .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: travel : broken-down bus reported on a30
text: travel : broken-down bus reported on a30
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: drowning rates soar in cornwall
text: the number of people who drowned in cornwall has more than doubled in 12 months .
twenty-one people drowned in the area last year , up from nine in 2015 .
in devon , the number of deaths fell by almost half to eight last year .
the rnli said more lives could be saved if people remembered to float for a short time to get used to the cold before attempting to swim or call for help .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: 'controlled explosion ' off plymouth but 'nothing to worry about ' , say police
text: this happens from time to time .
there will be a 500 m cordon by marine units .
all controlled and nothing to worry about .
hi .
do you have any more information ?
presumably this royal navy related ?
that 's all we know .
probably done it by now .
but they called to just make us aware .
it 's plymouth sound not actually on land ! ! !
do not panic ! mr mainwaring .
there will be a controlled explosion between 0800-0845 in plymouth sound.2 ordnances from a ship failed to fire

documents.title: missing elderly man 'turns up safe '
text: we have just returned from a search for an elderly man missing from a holiday home in north devon thankfully he turned up safe and well 114
where is your ec145 ?

documents.title: weatherwatchers : sunset and sunrise in lanivet - but which is which ?
text: two lovely from both ends of the day by carol in lanivet .
sunset yesterday and sunrise this morning .
but which is which ?
following on from your previous info kevin , sunset on the left , sunrise on the right ?
2 out of 2
sun set then sun rise
author: Kevin Thomas
BBC Weather Forecaster

documents.title: collision on a39 between bideford and barnstaple
text: police have reported a collision on the a39 between bideford and barnstaple .
officers tweeted that there would be delays while a vehicle blocking the carriageway was recovered .
collision on a39 between bideford and barnstaple delays whilst we recover a vehicle blocking the carriage way @ twitterid @ twitterid
thanks to your tweet about the a39 you helped others avoid traffic using the twitraffic iphone & android app
no issue .
thank you for retweeting
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: hundreds of thousands in court for council tax non-payment
text: more than 300,000 people in the south west have been taken to court for not paying their council tax over the past five years .
figures from a freedom of information request also revealed authorities in the region had lost more than £ 115m in non-payments .
cornwall and torbay are now among more than 1,000 authorities across the uk which are working with the government 's fraud initiative .
author: Anna Varle
BBC News Online

documents.title: local live in devon and cornwall
text: good morning , and welcome to bbc local live .
we will be bringing you all of the news , weather , travel and sport for devon and cornwall between 08:00 and 18:00 .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online
